data.event: The town was formed in 1819 from the town of Middletown.

In 1845 in what became known as the Anti-Rent War, protesters, several hundred dressed as "Calico Indians", shot and killed Under-Sheriff Osman Steele, when he and deputies attempted to collect overdue rent of about $64.

event.title: December 31, 2003, the incorporated village of Andes ceased

data.event: On December 31, 2003, the incorporated village of Andes ceased to exist.

event.title: a special village election on June 3, 2002

data.event: During a special village election on June 3, 2002, the residents approved dissolving the village by a vote of 81 to 63.

event.title: was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2003

data.event: The Jackson-Aitken Farm was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2003.
